cards.text: Using no more than three of the clips provided, shoot a process story.
This story can be brief, your goal is to use three different shots to illustrate an activity with a beginning, middle and end.
Some examples of process stories you can tell with 3 shots are: making coffee, writing a letter, packing a suitcase, making a sandwich.

goals: Place clips are good for establishing where your process story happens.

cards.text: Trim any clip by tapping the clip image.

goals: Character clips show us who is affected by or causing the process.
Action clips show the primary action in your process. Show the whole action.
Result clips show the result of your process. Show the result in context.
Signature clips show a very specific detail, can be the result or primary action. Get close!

cards.text: If you recorded clips in more than three cards, be sure to delete all but 3 clips before you publish.
By pressing "Order" on the next card, you will be able to review your clips, when you are happy with them, press publish.
Don't worry about narration immediately, we'll discuss that later.
When you finish uploading, return to class.
